content.rendered:
Photo by Negative Space

OK, you got me, I’m running slightly (very?) late this week, but there’s no sacrifice in quality This Week in Genesis with a new paid plugin, podcasts galore, and some shiny new features right here on GenesisWP.guide.

So put your running shoes on and let’s run through this together.

Themes

JT Grauke – maker of that stylish Showcase Pro theme over on StudioPress – has a tease of his new Maker Pro theme and its looking good.

Maker Pro, new Genesis theme in the works by @jtgrauke: #genesiswp #ui #ux #minimal #productdesign https://t.co/0VrUfT7uL8

— JT Grauke (@jtgrauke) May 9, 2016

2nd Preview of Maker Pro, a new Genesis theme I'm working on. Staying away from overlaying text on images and focusing more on simple typography and layout. What do you think? #genesiswp #ui #productdesign #typography #minimal #whitespace #ux #graphicdesign #webdesign

A photo posted by JT Grauke (@jtgrauke) on May 10, 2016 at 6:50am PDT

…plus he also wants to know what type of themes you’d like to see made for Genesis.

Hey #genesiswp, finish the sentence, "I wish there was a theme that…" GO!

— JT Grauke (@jtgrauke) May 12, 2016

Showcase

First up, I love this new site from works-progress.com

Thanks for the love @GenesisWPguide! https://t.co/EUxmPkdEdt

— Works Progress (@worksprogress) May 9, 2016

Also make sure you check out this different but appealing new site from Cami MacNamara for keithhowelldesign.com based on Lindsey Riel’s Swank theme.

Another site by Webcami launched – based on SWANK @lindseyriel @studiopress #genesiswp https://t.co/Q48gDN3516 pic.twitter.com/wP0WDFFKbp

— Cami MacNamara (@webcami) May 10, 2016

Oh and I love this portfolio from Emily White and Greg Young.

Finally got our portfolio updated. Check out what @hbgreg and I have been up to: https://t.co/OP1bESiERy. All custom #genesiswp sites.

— Emily White (@emwhitedesigns) May 10, 2016

Podcasts

Not one, not two, but three podcasts this week about or kind of 😉 related to Genesis.

First up, the folks over at Imagely – creators of fine Genesis themes for photographers – are now putting out a regular podcast and this week they’re chatting Genesis theme and content creation.

Episode 14 – Think About Your Content First w/ Aaron Hockley

The Genesis community’s very own Carrie Dils chats to Mr Productised Services – Brian Casel – on Office Hours.fm.

My new sounds: Productizing Services, Episode 102 https://t.co/4043mBTSJG on #SoundCloud

— Office Hours Podcast (@officehoursfm) May 12, 2016

And over on WP Watercooler, they’re chatting about Beaver Builder, Genesis and a Beaver Builder add-on called Beaver Tunnels on their spin-off show, WPshowandtell.

Beaver Tunnels – WPshowandtell

Best of the rest

Chinmoy Paul releases a new paid plugin, Simple Grid Layouts. If you’ve tried it, let me know what you think.

Simple Grid Layouts #GenesisWP plugin is officially released now. https://t.co/9HyrpE7PVg #plugins #wordpress

— Genesis Developer (@genesisdevelopr) May 8, 2016

Genesis Don, Calvin Koepke is working on a new Genesis course (one to keep an eye out for).

How you plan for #genesiswp awesomeness. pic.twitter.com/5t3OCYUnY5

— Calvin Koepke (@cjkoepke) May 11, 2016

Heather Jones (aka vivalaviolette) is doing an awesome giveaway.

Need a new website design for your business or blog? Enter to win the Ultimate Website Design Giveaway! #girlboss https://t.co/2Ka4gxzm1z

— Heather Jones (@vivalaviolette) May 10, 2016

That man Neil Gee has updated his handy post on using the new WordPress custom-logo theme support with Genesis

Updated Post: Using the new WordPress custom-logo theme support with Genesis https://t.co/PUKALT0LaD @blogjunkie #genesiswp

— Neil Gee (@_neilgee) May 10, 2016

Josh Mallard’s got an update coming soon to his Genesis Shortcode Generator plugin.

Genesis Shortcode Generator version 2.1 is coming soon and includes integration with Shortcake UI https://t.co/PNv0KB0TQ4 #genesiswp

— Josh Mallard (@aBearded_Ginger) May 9, 2016

And finally…

Like to chat Genesis? You can now comment on any https://t.co/vUGfVnMBds listing… pic.twitter.com/ik8zZOey8Q

— GenesisWPguide (@GenesisWPguide) May 9, 2016

I’ve now added comments to listings on GenesisWP.guide and each listing has its own page now too. There’s a lot (lot) more to come on this but if you haven’t seen the Listings yet please give them a look and maybe upvote or comment on something you like to show the creator some love!

That’s all from me this week.

You stay classy Genesis WordPress.

PS If I missed your awesome thing, I’m very sorry, it definitely wasn’t deliberate. Instead just add it to the site as a new listing and it’ll get seen by me (and a bunch of other people too).

excerpt.rendered: A new paid plugin, Genesis podcasts galore, and some shiny new features right here on GenesisWP.guide.
